content.question: A student attaches a block to a horizontal spring so that the block-spring system will oscillate if the block-spring system released from rest at a horizontal position that is not the system’s equilibrium position. The student creates a graph of the block-spring system’s kinetic energy as a function of time, as shown. The spring potential energy of the block-spring system at <math alttext="5.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
